data.title: De Coligny, De Laval, Musse, De Meullon, d'Entremont
data.text:
Part 2, see part 1 message for other details.

The connection of generation 1 to parents is from

a theory by Jo M.C.Smith, the rest is my compilation

from various references, primarily Chenaye-Desbois,

Dictionnaire de la Noblesse...

1 HELIE, Madeleine (du Tillet?)

b.1610? ID a theory; d.30 Sep 1692 France

m1. 1631

MIUS D'ENTREMONT, Philippe sgr.dePobomcoup

alleged son of [ClaudeAntoine/COLIGNY,Beatrix],

b.1609 ID a theory; d.1700 Pobomcoup,Acadie

He and his wife arrived at Port Royal in 1651 on the

staff of Gen. Charles de Latour. He was awarded

the title- Seigneur de Pobomcoup by Latour in 1653.

He resided in Pobomcoup shortly thereafter. He served

as temporary Governor of Acadie when Charles Latour

was absent. Given Name: Francois Virginie.

--- Parents

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------

2 TILLET DE NOGENT, Helie 2 brn.du, b.1576?

m1.18 Jul 1604;

[] = [Parents of person to the left, Dad/Mom]

{} = {ahnentafel # of 1st.occurrance of this person}

? = Data is a guess or is otherwise believed unreliable.

Hope this helps. Any additions or corrections appreciated.

Mike Talbot

This is part 1 of the data promised in previous

message on this topic. Part 2 to follw.

The relationship of generation 1 to parents is

a speculative theory by Jo M.C.Smith. The rest is

my compilation of data from various references,

primarily Chenaye-Desbois, Dict.de la Noblesse...

1 MIUS D'ENTREMONT, Philipe sgr.dePobomcoup

b.1609 ID a theory; d.ca.1700 Pobomcoup,Acadie

He and his wife arrived in Acadia in 1651 on the staff of

Maj.Gen. Charles de LaTour. He was awarded the title- Seigneur

de Pobomcoup by LaTour in 1653. He resided in Pobomcoup shortly

thereafter. He served as temporary Governor of Acadie when

Charles de LaTour was absent. The son of Claude Antoine

married to Madeleine duTillet was named Francois Virginie.

m1. 1631

HELIE, Madeleine (duTillet?), b.1610? ID a theory based

on the alleged ID of her husband. d.30 Sep 1692 France

--- Parents

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------

2 MEULLON, Claude Antoine de Montauban de

b.1570?, allegedly adopted by friends of Adm.Coligny.

For the theory to be true, he must be the adopted son of the

gov.de Marseille and wife, and the genetic son of Nicolas Mius.

Parents of Philippe Mius are speculation and a

theory of Mrs. Jo M.C.Smith. All of this is pretty "ify"

with no proof. Meullon spelling as per

Dictionnaire de la Noblesse...

3 COLIGNY, Beatrix cts.d'Entremont [Gaspard 2 adm/MONTBEL,Jacqueline],

b.21 Dec 1572 Chatillon-surLoing

---

Grandparents--------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------

4 MIUS, Nicolas, b.1530? German interp. for Coligny;

d.24 Aug 1572 St.Barthelemy's Day Massacre.

The German interpreter of Adm.Gaspard de Coligny.

His children were adopted by friends and members of

the admiral's family after the massacre.

m1.5 Jun 1569

5 Jeanne

The Mius daughters, Charlotte and Louise are mentioned

in the will of the wife of Wm.the Silent, prince of

Orange-Nassau.

6 COLIGNY, Gaspard 2 adm.de, b.16 Feb 1519 Chatillon surLong;

d.24 Aug 1572 St.Barthelemy Day Massacre.

He became a Huguenot in 1560 at the urging of his brother,

Francois. He became the leader of the movement in 1569 upon

the death of the Prince de Conde (Louis I de Bourbon-Conde).

NOTE----> Other wife m1.16 Jun 1547; LAVAL, Charlotte de

dau.of [Guy 16 ct/DAILLON,Antoinette]b.1530?

m2.24 Mar 1571 LaRochelle;

7 MONTBEL, Jacqueline cts.d'Entremont,

b.1541 Isere,Savoy; d.6 Jul 1600 Geneva,Huguenot

She was 30 years old at her marriage to Adm.Coligny.

The marriage was opposed by her family, so she ran away

to LaRochelle to be married.

--- ggParents

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------

12 COLIGNY, Gaspard sr.deFromente de [Jean 3 sr/COURCELLES,Eleonore]

b.1470? Chatillon surLoing,Fr.; d.4 Aug 1522 Dax,Bayonne,Fr.

He was Marshal de Chatillon sur Loing. His sons became

Huguenots around 1560 and were leaders in the movement.

m1.1 Dec 1514 Paris;

13 MONTMORENCY, Marie Louise de, b.1490? Paris; d.1541

She was sister of mareschal Anne deMontmorency.

14 MONTBEL, Sebastien ct.d'Entremont,

b.1520? Isere,Savoy; Catholic

m1.17 Sep 1539

15 ESCALONA, Beatriz Pacheco de, b.1520? Spain; d.27 Dec 1582

Her parentage is given as (only) the Duque de Escalona by

"Dictionaiire de la Noblesse...". It is an assumption that

she was the legitimate child of this duke and his last wife.

--- 2ggParents

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------

24 COLIGNY, Jean 3 sr.dem b.1440? Chatillon surLong; d.1480

m1. 1464

25 COURCELLES, Eleonore de, b.1445? France; d.1510?

26 MONTMORENCY, Guillaume brn.de, b.1455? Paris; d.24 May 1531

His grandson Adm.Gaspard deColigny was to lead the Huguenot

movement after 1569. Son, Duc Anne was a leader of the

anti-Huguenot forces. The family were staunch Catholics,

but supported a negotiated settlement with the Huguenots.

His grandson, Duc Henri deMontmorency(1534-1614), was a

leader of the negotiated settlement faction.

m1.17 Jul 1484

27 POT, Anne de Rochepot-Thore, b.1470?, d.24 Feb 1510

28 MONTBEL, Charles sr.d'Entremont, b.1460? Savoy; d.1537

m1.10 Jul 1499

29 CHIEL, Francoise de, b.1480?

30 ESCALONA, Diego-Lopes 2 Pacheco 2.duc de,

b.1460? Spain; d.6 Nov 1529

31 MELGAR-CASTILE, Juana Enriquez de, b.1480? Spain; d.26 Apr 1530
